Sentencas: A solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) structure is proposed in which a composite thin film cathode substrate supports a dense thin film electrolyte with a thickness of less than 1 mu m.
Titulo: Processing of composite thin film solid oxide fuel cell structures

Sentencas: The cathode substrate has a graded porosity achieved through the partial sintering of a spin-coated CeO2 colloidal suspension.
Titulo: Processing of composite thin film solid oxide fuel cell structures

Sentencas: The resulting surface has a pore size and surface roughness which allowed a fully dense ZrO2:16%Y (YSZ) electrolyte to be spin-coated directly from a polymeric precursor without capillary forces removing the precursor from the surface of the porous substrate.
Titulo: Processing of composite thin film solid oxide fuel cell structures

Sentencas: Using this process, fuel cell structures were constructed with temperatures not exceeding 800 degrees C.
Titulo: Processing of composite thin film solid oxide fuel cell structures

Sentencas: The porous CeO2 interlayer should allow for decreased ohmic losses, as well as decreased reactions between the YSZ and the cathode substrate.
Titulo: Processing of composite thin film solid oxide fuel cell structures

Sentencas: In addition, the nanocrystalline grain sizes should allow for increased catalytic activity on the cathode.
Titulo: Processing of composite thin film solid oxide fuel cell structures

Sentencas: Calculated ohmic losses indicated the resistance of the CeO2 interlayer limited the power of the structure, which was minimized by impregnating the porous layer with a mixed-conducting perovskite.
Titulo: Processing of composite thin film solid oxide fuel cell structures

Sentencas: The final structure shows significantly reduced ohmic losses as calculated at 400 degrees C.
Titulo: Processing of composite thin film solid oxide fuel cell structures
